FuncDef: This command creates an ingress or egress queue group on an Ethernet port. A queue group is a collection of queues identified by a group name. Queue groups created on access ports are used as an alternative queue destination for SAPs.

ParaDef.Info: The group-name parameter is required when executing the port queue-group command. The specified group-name must exist as an ingress or egress queue group template depending on the ingress or egress context of the port queue group. Only a single queue group may be created on an ingress port. Multiple queue groups may be created on an egress port.
Specifies the identification of a specific instance of the queue-group. Values-1 to 65535.
Keyword used to associate the queue group. The create keyword requirement can be enabled/disabled in the environment>create context.
